headline.main: LATER FROM CALIFORNIA AND AUSTRALIA.; Arrival of the United states.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship United States, Capt. WM. C. BERRY, from Aspinwall, arrived at 3 o'clock this morning, with passengers and treasure to JONES JOHNSON. The United States left Aspinwall Feb. 18, at 5.30 P.M., and Kingston Feb. 21, at 3 P.M., connecting with steamship Cortez, (of New-York and San Francisco Steamship Line,) which ship arrived at Panama Feb. 15, at 6 A.M., from San Francisco Feb. 1.

headline.main: INDIANA.; Doings of the Legislature--Political, Banking, and Railroad Transactions--General News, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Matters here are too easy and times too dull for the fabrication of news. It is hard to get items of greater importance then the decline in pork and the rise in Eastern exchange. You will not, therefore, expect much "thrilling interest" in my humble letter.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times:

headline.main: Letter from Bishop Whittingham, of Maryland

docs.lead_paragraph: The Southern Churchman publishes the following letter from Rt. Rev. Bishop WHITTINGHAM, Of the Episcopal Diocese of Maryland, defining his position in regard to the ordinances and belief of the Church.
docs.snippet: The Southern Churchman publishes the following letter from Rt. Rev. Bishop WHITTINGHAM, Of the Episcopal Diocese of Maryland, defining his position in regard to the ordinances and belief of the Church.

headline.main: CHAPTERS ON LIBRARIES.; No. I.--The Mercantile Library Association.

docs.lead_paragraph: ...."Books Are a substantial world." The degree of intellectual vigor in any community must depend in great measure upon the literary opportunity that is afforded. The abundance of books, the prevalence of newspapers, the speedy processes of the Press, go to indicate the culture enjoyed by the mass of the people, and serve very cleverly to place the society in its proper rank for intelligence and enterprise.
docs.abstract: History and description of the Mercantile

docs.lead_paragraph: A RETURNED CALIFORNIA--Mr. A. TINK-HAM, one of our old citizens, reached this place on Saturday last, on his return from California. Few of his intimate friends could recognize in the erect form, the keen black eye, the energetic man, as he was when be left here some two years ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, says the San Antonia Texan, a company of the Rifles brought in some nineteen or twenty Indian prisoners, a portion of a party they had pursued and captured, after killing eight of their number. They also captured a large number of horses.
docs.snippet: Last week, says the San Antonia Texan, a company of the Rifles brought in some nineteen or twenty Indian prisoners, a portion of a party they had pursued and captured, after killing eight of their number. They also captured a large number of horses.

headline.main: Letter from C. Edwards Lester.; To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: In the absence probably of a more attractive theme, you chose in your paper of the 231 inst., to bestow nearly two columns of a leader upon myself; and furnished the public with some very flattering allusions to my former history and pursuits.
docs.snippet: SIR: In the absence probably of a more attractive theme, you chose in your paper of the 231 inst., to bestow nearly two columns of a leader upon myself; and furnished the public with some very flattering allusions to my former history and pursuits.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is a portion of a paper real before the Academy of Medicine, by Dr. A. K. GARDNER, of this city. We find it in the last number of the New-York Journal of Medicine.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ruth, a Novel.--TICKNOR CO., BOSTON; EVANS BRITTAN, New-York. The authoress of Mary Barton, secured by that publication a name hardly less notable than CHARLES KINGS LEY'S, as compassionate fried of the working classes.
